com.tinkerpop.blueprints

Interface IndexableGraph

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Graph
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EventIndexableGraph, EventTransactionalIndexableGraph, IdGraph, Neo4jBatchGraph, Neo4jGraph, Neo4jHaGraph, OrientBaseGraph, OrientGraph, OrientGraphNoTx, OrientTransactionalGraph, PartitionIndexableGraph, ReadOnlyIndexableGraph, ReadOnlyKeyIndexableGraph, RexsterGraph, TinkerGraph, WrappedIndexableGraph

    public interface IndexableGraph
extends Graph
    An IndexableGraph is a graph that supports the manual indexing of its elements. An index is typically some sort of tree structure that allows for the fast lookup of elements by key/value pairs. Indices have an Index object associated with them and allow the user to specify the putting and getting of elements into the index.
    Author:
    Marko A. Rodriguez (http://markorodriguez.com)

    • Method Detail

      • createIndex

        <T extends Element> Index<T> createIndex(String indexName,
                                       Class<T> indexClass,
                                       Parameter... indexParameters)
        Generate an index with a particular name for a particular class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the element class that this index is indexing (can be base class)
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the manual index
        indexClass - the element class that this index is indexing (can be base class)
        indexParameters - a collection of parameters for the underlying index implementation
        Returns:
        the index created

      • getIndex

        <T extends Element> Index<T> getIndex(String indexName,
                                    Class<T> indexClass)
        Get an index from the graph by its name and index class. An index is unique up to name.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the elements being indexed (can be base class)
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index to retrieve
        indexClass - the class of the elements being indexed (can be base class)
        Returns:
        the retrieved index

      • getIndices

        Iterable<Index<? extends Element>> getIndices()
        Get all the indices maintained by the graph.
        Returns:
        the indices associated with the graph

      • dropIndex

        void dropIndex(String indexName)
        Remove an index associated with the graph.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index to drop
